business.headline: Amazon to cut 14,000 corporate jobs amid company's AI push to slash costsAmazon will cut about 14,000 corporate jobs, its biggest layoffs since 2023, as it ramps up artificial intelligence investments and trims costs under CEO Andy Jassy's ongoing restructuring plan.

Apple joins Microsoft, Nvidia in exclusive $4 trillion market-cap clubApple is now the third member of the $4 trillion market-cap club, joining Nvidia—currently valued above $4.5 trillion—and Microsoft, which re-entered the group following gains linked to its partnership with OpenAI.
Sensex, Nifty end slightly lower amid volatility and profit bookingThe S&P BSE Sensex slipped 75.11 points to close at 84,703.73 and the NSE Nifty50 fell 29.85 points to settle at 25,936.20.

Mehli Mistry set to exit Tata Trusts after trustees block reappointmentMehli Mistry, who joined both trusts in 2022, has been regarded as a close associate of the late Ratan Tata. The Sir Dorabji Tata Trust and the Sir Ratan Tata Trust together hold the largest shareholding in Tata Sons and play a central role in board nominations and governance across the Tata Group.

Cabinet clears terms of reference for 8th Pay CommissionInformation and Broadcasting Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw confirmed that the government has finalised the commission's composition, mandate and timelines.

What's driving the 6% rise in office rentals across India's major cities?Average monthly office rentals increased from Rs 85 per sq. ft. in the first nine months of 2024 to Rs 90 per sq. ft. in the same period of 2025. Bengaluru saw the sharpest rise of about 9%, followed by steady gains in cities like Pune and Delhi-NCR.

Indian refiners halt new Russian oil deals, await clarity amid sanctions: ReportLast week, the US imposed new sanctions on Russia's two largest oil producers, Lukoil and Rosneft, expanding restrictions already in place from the European Union and the UK over the war in Ukraine. The fresh measures have forced Indian buyers to reassess supply routes and payment mechanisms.

Peyush Bansal's Lenskart IPO opens on October 31. Here's all you need to knowPeyush Bansal-led Lenskart is set to hit the primary market on October 31 with its Rs 7,278 crore IPO. Backed by a strong brand presence and rapid expansion, the issue is among the most awaited listings of 2025.

6 hidden home loan traps your bank won't tell you. Expert shares smart hacksBuying your dream home can quickly turn stressful when hidden costs and surprise clauses appear. From processing fees to "mandatory" insurance, a tax expert shares six practical hacks every borrower should know before signing their home loan papers.

How a CRPF officer fought insurer for his autistic son's treatmentWhen CRPF officer Syam Krishna's autistic son fell ill, doctors advised hospitalisation. But his insurer called it "unnecessary" and even questioned the family's claim history. This week's 'Claim Denied' story reveals how genuine policyholders are forced to fight for rightful care.

Why quitting SIPs within 3 years is a costly mistakeStarting an SIP is easy, staying invested isn't. An expert explains why most Indian investors quit too soon, and how this one mistake can cost them lakhs in the long run.

MCX glitch halts gold, silver futures trade; check latest updateIn a series of updates issued throughout the morning, MCX stated that the issue was being addressed and that trading would now commence from its Disaster Recovery (DR) site. However, the exchange did not specify a fresh start time.

Vodafone Idea share price: What are analysts saying after AGR ruling?Analysts see fresh hope for Vodafone Idea after the AGR ruling, with Motilal Oswal, Emkay, and Citi turning positive on the stock and projecting scope for further upside.

Amazon's biggest-ever layoffs: Why 30,000 jobs are on the lineThe layoffs will affect nearly 10% of Amazon's 350,000 corporate employees, though that's only a fraction of its 1.55 million total workforce.

Sensex, Nifty open flat amid profit booking; PSU banks in focus on FDI cap buzzAt around 9:18 am, the S&P BSE Sensex was trading 66.76 points higher at 84,845.60, while the NSE Nifty50 edged up 14.25 points to 25,980.30.

Paramount to cut 1,000 jobs ahead of merger with Warner BrosThe job cuts, which follow the $8.4 billion merger between Skydance Media and Paramount Global, would impact roughly 5% of Paramount's employees based on its workforce prior to the completion of the deal.

Gold price at Rs 1.21 lakh, silver dips sharply: More correction ahead?According to analysts, the dip was both expected and healthy after gold prices shot up from nearly Rs 75,000 to Rs 1.30 lakh in just a few months. A correction of about 10–15% was on the cards, which would bring prices closer to Rs 1.15 lakh per 10 grams.

Amazon to target 30,000 corporate workers in largest ever job cuts: ReportAmazon will lay off up to 30,000 corporate employees starting Tuesday, its biggest round of cuts since 2022, as the tech giant trims costs and corrects pandemic-era overhiring across divisions.

Sensex, Nifty end higher as trade optimism boosts market sentimentThe S&P BSE Sensex climbed 566.96 points to close at 84,778.84, while the NSE Nifty50 advanced 170.90 points to settle at 25,966.05. Broader markets also participated in the rally, even as volatility edged up ahead of the monthly F&O expiry.

How credit cards fuelled India's Diwali shopping partyA new survey has revealed how Indians turned to credit cards for high-value festive buys this Diwali, planning purchases smartly around cashback offers, no-cost EMIs and online deals.

entertainment.headline: Bigg Boss 19: Jannat Zubair backs Ashnoor Kaur, as Tanya, Kunickaa body-shame her Actor Jannat Zubair came out strongly in support of Ashnoor Kaur amid body-shaming on 'Bigg Boss 19'. The controversy highlights ongoing challenges regarding body image and respect in Indian reality TV.

Nora Fatehi joins J Balvin, REMA and Martin Garrix to headline at UNTOLD Dubai Nora Fatehi is all set to join 'UNTOLD Dubai 2025' as a headliner alongside global stars. Her debut of a new international single adds excitement to the festival's star-studded lineup.

Captain America's Chris Evans and Alba Baptista quietly welcome first child Actor couple Chris Evans and Alba Baptista have welcomed their first child in Massachusetts. The private birth adds to their low-profile family life following a quiet 2023 wedding.

Diljit Dosanjh makes history: First Indian to sell stadium show in Sydney Diljit Dosanjh became the first Indian to sell a stadium show in Sydney. Tickets for the show were sold out, some going for as high as $800 each with 30,000 fans in attendance.

Film body urges PM Modi to confer Padma Shri posthumously on Satish Shah The Federation of Western India Cine Employees (FWICE) appealed to Prime Minister Narendra Modi to posthumously confer upon Padma Shri to late actor Satish Shah for his contribution to cinema and television.

Enrique Iglesias arrives in India for his two-day concert in Mumbai. Watch Spanish singer-songwriter Enrique Iglesias landed in India on Tuesday ahead of his two-day concert in Mumbai. He waved at the cameras and interacted with the paparazzi at Mumbai's Kalina Airport.

High Court halts Ravi Mohan from using Bro Code as title for film, team reacts Delhi High Court has temporarily stopped Ravi Mohan Studios from using the title 'Bro Code' due to a trademark dispute. The decision escalates legal tensions between the filmmakers and Indo-Spirit Beverages over brand rights.

Nobody Wants This Season 2 is couch potato's guide to non-toxic love done right 'Nobody Wants This Season 2' on Netflix turns ordinary domesticity into a lesson on emotional maturity. Starring Adam Brody and Kristen Bell, the show proves that communication, vulnerability, and humour can make modern love beautifully non-toxic.

Navya Nanda shares insight into Bachchan family: We don't fight, we debate Amitabh Bachchan's granddaughter, Navya Naveli Nanda, recently talked about the dynamics in the Bachchan household. She highlighted that her family often has conversations around topics that are relevant today and that matter.

Kantara Chapter 1 makers clarify early OTT release: Deal was done 3 years ago 'Kantara: Chapter 1' will premiere on Prime Video on October 31, just weeks after its theatrical release. Hombale Films clarifies that the early OTT drop stems from a three-year-old agreement.

Bigg Boss Tamil 9: Wildcards Prajin, Divya Ganesh, Amit Bhargav enter show 'Bigg Boss Tamil Season 9' has introduced three new wildcard contestants to intensify the competition. The new entries promise fresh drama amid warnings over violent behaviour inside the house.

Travis Scott to Enrique Iglesias: Is live music India's hottest cultural currency Mumbai is set to welcome Spanish singer Enrique Iglesias for a major concert at MMRDA Grounds. American rapper Travis Scott also performed in India recently. India Today offers insights on India's rapidly growing live music industry supported by changing consumer habits and government initiatives.

Bigg Boss Kannada 12: College-themed task stirs drama The latest season of Bigg Boss Kannada introduced a fun task this week, setting up a retro-themed college with house captain Mutant Raghu heading the gang as the college principal.

Mahhi Vij reacts to Jay Bhanushali's post with daughter Tara amid divorce talk Amid reports of marital issues, Mahhi Vij commented on a light-hearted video shared by Jay Bhanushali with their daughter Tara.  One of the most popular couples on Indian television, the duo have reportedly filed for divorce.

Vidya Balan recalls being offered debut film Parineeta at Enrique's Mumbai concert Enrique Iglesias is set to perform in Mumbai after 20 years with a two-day concert. Vidya Balan recalled her debut film offer during his 2004 concert, highlighting a memorable career moment.

Priyamani opens up on pay disparity: I know my worth, I charge what I deserve 'The Family Man' actor Priyamani shared her views on gender-based pay gaps, saying she focuses on her market value rather than comparisons with male co-stars.

Rashmika Mandanna on long shooting hours: We should stop glorifying overworking The debate on work hours in the Indian film industry is heating up, with actor Rashmika Mandanna calling for fixed schedules and healthier work conditions.

Rohan Mehra slams BB 19's Tanya, Kunickaa and Neelam for body-shaming Ashnoor TV actor Rohan Mehra has called out 'Bigg Boss 19' contestants Tanya Mittal, Kunickaa Sadanand and Neelam Giri on social media. He slammed the trio for body-shaming Ashnoor Kaur on the reality show.

Rukmini Vasanth shares rare behind-the-scenes glimpse from Kantara Chapter 1 set Rukmini Vasanth has shared unseen moments from the making of 'Kantara Chapter 1', revealing her intense preparation and behind-the-scenes discussions with director Rishab Shetty.

general news.headline: Cyclone Montha crosses Andhra coast after midnight, IMD says storm to weaken soonThe severe cyclonic storm Montha made landfall between Machilipatnam and Kalingapatnam in the early hours of Wednesday, bringing heavy rain and strong winds to Andhra Pradesh and Yanan before beginning to weaken into a cyclonic storm.

Netanyahu orders 'powerful' Gaza strikes as hostage remains dispute threaten truceBenjamin Netanyahu on Tuesday ordered "powerful strikes" in Gaza, accusing Hamas of violating the ceasefire. Hamas, in turn, also accused Israel of ceasefire violations and delayed a planned body handover.

Hurricane Melissa makes landfall in Jamaica, island nation braces for catastropheHurricane Melissa, one of the strongest storms ever to hit the Caribbean, made landfall in southern Jamaica on Tuesday, unleashing catastrophic winds and flooding. Prime Minister Andrew Holness said the storm will inflict "catastrophic damage," urging residents to remain indoors and brace for impact as international aid efforts ramp up.

After cloud seeding, Delhi still dry. Minister points to low moisture factorSpeaking exclusively to India Today, Environment Minister Manjinder Singh Sirsa explained that the trial on Tuesday was conducted to check if cloud seeding can be done in moisture conditions of 10–15%.

Trump's clueless stroll as he reviews guard of honour in Tokyo, video is viralTrump arrived in Tokyo on a three-day visit to Japan on Tuesday and held bilateral talks with Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi to boost defence and economic ties.

Cyclone Montha Live: Landfall underway, storm maintains strength with 110 kmph windsCyclone Montha Live Updates: Severe cyclonic storm Montha has begun to make landfall between Machilipatnam and Kakinada, bringing strong winds, heavy rainfall and coastal flooding risks across Andhra Pradesh. One death has been reported so far, while authorities have opened relief camps, issued safety advisories, and suspended train services in affected regions. Stay with indiatoday.in for the latest updates.

Liar, insensitive: Zohran Mamdani trolled over 'aunt in fear after 9/11' remarkZohran Mamdani, a leading contender in the New York City mayoral race, is under scrutiny after his comments about his aunt in fear of travelling on a subway in a hijab following the 9/11 attacks. He clarified later he was talking about his father's cousin.

1 job per family, Rs 2,500 for women: Mahagathbandhan goes with populist playbookWith just days left for the Bihar elections, the Mahagathbandhan released its poll manifesto, outlining a wide-ranging agenda focusing on employment, welfare, and governance reforms.

What it felt on the plane in eye of Hurricane Melissa: Jaw-dropping, but poignantA Hurricane Hunter aircraft pierced Hurricane Melissa's eye, capturing rare cockpit footage of its 22-mile-wide clear centre. The Category 5 storm, packing 175 mph winds, is heading towards Jamaica. Here is what those on the plane felt while they were in the eye of the storm, literally.

Finished Kohli > Prime Babar: Fans tear into Pakistan batter after 0 on T20I returnBabar Azam was heavily trolled after failing to open his account against South Africa, where Corbin Bosch dismissed him for a duck. Fans criticised the comparisons with Virat Kohli, saying Babar should not be measured against a player of Kohli's class and calibre.

1 in 3 Bihar poll candidates face criminal charges, 40% are crorepatis: ReportA report by the Association for Democratic Reforms (ADR) and Bihar Election Watch reveals that 32% of candidates have declared criminal cases against themselves, including 27% facing serious charges such as murder and crimes against women.

Outrage as Sikh trucker who killed 3 in US crash brought in court without turbanA 21-year-old Indian truck driver, Jashanpreet Singh, accused of causing a crash that killed three in California, appeared in a US court without his turban, sparking outrage among Sikh community and leaders, including Shiromani Akali Dal chief Sukhbir Singh Badal. A petition has also been created seeking authorities to "restore his religious rights".

Delhi HC ruling, and alimony law firestorm ignited by Yuzvendra ChahalThe Chahal divorce and a recent Delhi High Court ruling have ignited a nationwide debate on the future of alimony in India. This discussion centers on financial independence, fairness, and legal expectations in modern marriages.

Bengal man dies by suicide over NRC fear, triggers Mamata Banerjee-BJP spatA 57-year-old man's death in West Bengal's North 24 Parganas district allegedly over fears related to NRC has led to a heated exchange between Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee and BJP's Amit Malviya.

Man in Frankfurt says 10-minute delivery in India feels like 'teleportation' to GermansIn a now-viral LinkedIn post, an Indian man based in Frankfurt compared Germany's delivery system with India's. Here's what he had to say:

Bengaluru tunnel road: BJP MP urges metro push, DK Shivakumar says get funds firstBengaluru South BJP MP Tejasvi Surya met Deputy Chief Minister DK Shivakumar to discuss Bengaluru's traffic issues, urging funds from the tunnel road project be redirected to the Metro and stressing public transport as the city's real solution.

The secret behind 1729: GH Hardy, Ramanujan and the world's most interesting numberThe number 1729 may look ordinary, but a casual remark by Srinivasa Ramanujan turned it into a mathematical legend, symbolising insight, intuition, and the friendship that reshaped number theory forever.

Election Commission asks Prashant Kishor to explain 2 voter enrolments in 2 statesThe notice, served by the Returning Officer of Bihar's Kargahar constituency, cites Section 17 of the Representation of the People Act, which prohibits dual registration, and asks Kishor to respond within three days.

Mehli Mistry set to exit Tata Trusts after trustees block reappointmentMehli Mistry, who joined both trusts in 2022, has been regarded as a close associate of the late Ratan Tata. The Sir Dorabji Tata Trust and the Sir Ratan Tata Trust together hold the largest shareholding in Tata Sons and play a central role in board nominations and governance across the Tata Group.

A foreign country using Pakistan soil to hit Afghanistan with drones?A bombshell revelation has emerged in the Afghanistan-Pakistan peace talks in Turkey. Pakistan, for the first time, has admitted that it cannot prevent drone strikes inside Afghanistan due to a secret agreement with a foreign country. This comes just months after Islamabad began strengthening defence and strategic ties with the US, amid President Donald Trump's forceful public demand for the return of Bagram airbase.

'My partner is a hobosexual, but does that make her a gold-digger?'As living costs climb in metro cities, a new kind of relationship has quietly emerged: the hobosexual kind. But when affection comes bundled with dependence, how do you know if your partner's staying for love or if they are actually a gold digger?

How a CRPF officer fought insurer for his autistic son's treatmentWhen CRPF officer Syam Krishna's autistic son fell ill, doctors advised hospitalisation. But his insurer called it "unnecessary" and even questioned the family's claim history. This week's 'Claim Denied' story reveals how genuine policyholders are forced to fight for rightful care.

Sridhar Vembu's vaccine comment is not science, it's dangerous speculationWhen a billionaire entrepreneur starts talking like a vaccine sceptic, the harm goes far beyond a social media post. Zoho founder Sridhar Vembu's recent claim that India's sharp rise in autism is linked to "too many childhood vaccines" is more than just misinformed; it's reckless

Apple joins Microsoft, Nvidia in exclusive $4 trillion market-cap clubApple is now the third member of the $4 trillion market-cap club, joining Nvidia—currently valued above $4.5 trillion—and Microsoft, which re-entered the group following gains linked to its partnership with OpenAI.

sports.headline: Babar Azam flops as South Africa crush Pakistan by 55 runs in Rawalpindi PAK vs SA: South Africa crushed Pakistan by 55 runs in the first T20I at Rawalpindi, with George Linde starring in an all-round show. Babar Azam's return ended in disappointment as he fell for a duck, deepening Pakistan's batting woes.

Finished Kohli > Prime Babar: Fans tear into Pakistan batter after 0 on T20I return Babar Azam was heavily trolled after failing to open his account against South Africa, where Corbin Bosch dismissed him for a duck. Fans criticised the comparisons with Virat Kohli, saying Babar should not be measured against a player of Kohli's class and calibre.

Expecting an exciting South Africa contest despite group stage win: Sciver-Brunt England captain Nat Sciver-Brunt has said that she expects an exciting contest against South Africa in the semi-final despite hammering them in the group stages of the Women's World Cup 2025. South Africa were bundled out for 69 by England in the game.

Shardul Thakur eyes India return, aims to seal No.8 spot 2027 World Cup Shardul Thakur has said that he is eyeing an Indian comeback and wants to be part of the squad for the ODI World Cup 2027. Shardul was part of the India squad for the England tour and is currently the skipper of the Mumbai team.

How Jasprit Bumrah, Suryakumar Yadav inspired Shreyanka Patil amid injury layoff Shreyanka Patil opened up about her injury struggles and how Jasprit Bumrah and Suryakumar Yadav inspired her to stay positive and focused during her year-long layoff. The off-spinner, who missed the WPL season, is now playing in the Senior Women's T20 Trophy.

Nat Sciver-Brunt hopes India qualify for final, wants hosts to beat Australia Nat Sciver-Brunt expressed her hope to see India reach the Women's World Cup final, saying the atmosphere would be incredible if the hosts made it. On Wednesday, England will face South Africa in the first semi-final.

Hardik Pandya's injury shifts India's balance for Australia T20Is, says Irfan Pathan Former India all-rounder Irfan Pathan says Hardik Pandya's injury will affect India's balance in the T20I series against Australia. He backs a three-pacer strategy and picks Varun Chakravarthy over Kuldeep Yadav for his mystery spin in Australian conditions.

Care Today Foundation empowers young archers in Maharashtra's Wadhona A year after we showed the story of Dipak Wanve, a teacher who doubled as an archery coach and trained his students with limited means, and now India Today Group's Care Today Foundation has stepped in to provide professional archery equipment to these aspiring athletes.

Erling Haaland could be rested for EFL Cup clash after knock: Pep Guardiola Pep Guardiola hinted that Erling Haaland maybe rested for the EFL Cup clash against Swansea City after sustaining a knock in the Premier League loss to Aston Villa.

England great James Anderson receives knighthood for services to cricket England fast-bowling legend James Anderson has been knighted for his services to cricket. The 43-year-old, who took 704 Test wickets over a 22-year career, received the honour from the Princess Royal at Windsor Castle after retiring from Tests in 2024.

Hardik Pandya's injury shifts India's balance for Australia T20Is, says Irfan Pathan Former India all-rounder Irfan Pathan says Hardik Pandya's injury will affect India's balance in the T20I series against Australia. He backs a three-pacer strategy and picks Varun Chakravarthy over Kuldeep Yadav for his mystery spin in Australian conditions.

Care Today Foundation empowers young archers in Maharashtra's Wadhona A year after we showed the story of Dipak Wanve, a teacher who doubled as an archery coach and trained his students with limited means, and now India Today Group's Care Today Foundation has stepped in to provide professional archery equipment to these aspiring athletes.

Erling Haaland could be rested for EFL Cup clash after knock: Pep Guardiola Pep Guardiola hinted that Erling Haaland maybe rested for the EFL Cup clash against Swansea City after sustaining a knock in the Premier League loss to Aston Villa.

England great James Anderson receives knighthood for services to cricket England fast-bowling legend James Anderson has been knighted for his services to cricket. The 43-year-old, who took 704 Test wickets over a 22-year career, received the honour from the Princess Royal at Windsor Castle after retiring from Tests in 2024.

Rizwan declines Pakistan central contract over dispute with PCB: ReportsMohammad Rizwan has reportedly declined the PCB's 2025–26 central contract, a development that follows his removal as ODI captain and exclusion from the T20I series against South Africa.

Mohammed Shami ready to make India comeback: There is cricket left in meMohammed Shami has said that he is keeping himself ready to make an Indian comeback after continuing his fine run in the Ranji Trophy this season. Shami last played for India during the Champions Trophy this year.

Dani Carvajal out for three months after knee surgery post El Clasico winReal Madrid defender Dani Carvajal has undergone successful knee surgery after El Clasico. The injury sidelines him for up to three months, impacting Madrid's defensive options.

South Africa have a really good shot at winning semis vs England: Laura WolvaardtWomen's World Cup 2025, ENG vs SA: Laura Wolvaardt said that South Africa are more than capable of taking down England in the semi-final on Wednesday in Guwahati. Earlier in the tournament, the Proteas had lost to the Brits by 10 wickets after being bowled out for 69.

Alyssa Healy on track to return for semi-final clash against IndiaAustralian skipper Alyssa Healy edges closer to a comeback in the Women's World Cup 2025 semi-final versus India after clearing a demanding fitness assessment in Mumbai. Her return will be a huge cause of concern for India as Healy earlier slammed a century in group stage clash against the hosts.

Superstar Abhishek Sharma ready to play all three formats for India: Michael ClarkeMichael Clarke feels that Abhishek Sharma is ready to play all three formats for India ahead of the T20I series against Australia. Abhishek is in imperial form in the shortest format of the game.

Alex Carey ready for Barmy Army taunts as Ashes stumping row still echoes in 2025Alex Carey is bracing for Barmy Army taunts as Australia prepare to host England in the 2025 Ashes. Two years after his stumping of Jonny Bairstow sparked a Spirit of Cricket storm, the wicketkeeper says he is ready for the noise and focused on the cricket.

England are also under pressure: Wolvaardt wants South Africa to stay calm in semisLaura Wolvaardt has urged South Africa to stay calm and trust their skills ahead of the Women's World Cup semi-final against England, emphasising mental strength over skills.

Alyssa Healy on track to return for semi-final clash against IndiaAustralian skipper Alyssa Healy edges closer to a comeback in the Women's World Cup 2025 semi-final versus India after clearing a demanding fitness assessment in Mumbai. Her return will be a huge cause of concern for India as Healy earlier slammed a century in group stage clash against the hosts.

Superstar Abhishek Sharma ready to play all three formats for India: Michael ClarkeMichael Clarke feels that Abhishek Sharma is ready to play all three formats for India ahead of the T20I series against Australia. Abhishek is in imperial form in the shortest format of the game.

Alex Carey ready for Barmy Army taunts as Ashes stumping row still echoes in 2025Alex Carey is bracing for Barmy Army taunts as Australia prepare to host England in the 2025 Ashes. Two years after his stumping of Jonny Bairstow sparked a Spirit of Cricket storm, the wicketkeeper says he is ready for the noise and focused on the cricket.

England are also under pressure: Wolvaardt wants South Africa to stay calm in semisLaura Wolvaardt has urged South Africa to stay calm and trust their skills ahead of the Women's World Cup semi-final against England, emphasising mental strength over skills.

Gukesh gets his revenge on Hikaru Nakamura, but plays it cool to win over internetGukesh Dommaraju kept his cool to beat Hikaru Nakamura at the 2025 Clutch Chess Showdown, just weeks after their viral Checkmate controversy. His calm revenge win and quiet composure won over fans and the internet alike.

Shreyas Iyer out of ICU, recovering well after rib injury in Sydney ODIIndia's ODI vice-captain Shreyas Iyer is out of the ICU and has stepped his recovery from the rib injury he suffered during the third match of the series against Australia in Sydney. Sources have said that Shreyas has started talking to his teammates and eating solid food.

AUS vs IND 1st T20I Predicted XI: Will India continue with 3 spinners in Canberra?India are set to play Australia in the first T20I at Manuka Oval without key all-rounder Hardik Pandya. The team has a tough task of fielding the best possible combination in the absence of their seasoned all-rounder.

Joe Root leads wishes for England before Women's World Cup semis vs South AfricaEngland women's cricket team prepares to face South Africa in the Women's World Cup semi-final on October 29. Key players and male teammates have expressed strong support ahead of the crucial knockout match.

How a simple chat with Temba Bavuma sparked Simon Harmer's return to Test cricketA chat between Temba Bavuma and Simon Harmer after the WTC final reignited the off-spinner's Test career. After years away, Harmer's return brought experience, balance, and 1,000 first-class wickets to a rejuvenated South African spin attack.

Smriti Mandhana among Player of the Tournament nominees for Women's World CupStar Indian batter Smriti Mandhana leads the ICC Women's World Cup 2025 award nominees after topping the tournament run charts, including a crucial hundred against New Zealand, and joining Deepti Sharma in record-breaking all-round feats.

Messi remains open to playing World Cup 2026 despite age, fitness concernsLionel Messi has expressed his strong desire to participate in the 2026 World Cup, calling the opportunity to defend Argentina's title "extraordinary." The Argentine maestro admitted that his participation will depend on his fitness and age at the end of the day.

England sweat over Sophie Ecclestone's fitness ahead of South Africa semi-finalEngland are sweating over spinner Sophie Ecclestone's fitness ahead of their Women's World Cup semi-final against South Africa, after she sustained a shoulder injury in the last group match against New Zealand.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
